item.title: Report X-2024071786
item.description:
Report X-2024071786

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-19
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: This package was brought to the QA cage by the van line manager because of a big wet area on the top and side of the package. Upon inspection, we discovered that one of the four bottles had a loose cap which caused the leak inside the package. We made sure to place this package in a lined hazmat tote and moved this to the hazmat cage.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: CALL WAS MADE TO THE DMP CAGE ABOUT A POSSIBLE LEAKING HAZMAT. DESIGNATED RESPONDER FOUND THE PACKAGE ON THE GROUND WET. PACKAGE WAS OPENED AND FOUND TO BE MISSING 1 TOP. FOLLOWING ALL PROPER RESPONDER METHODS, PACKAGE WAS SECURED AND RETURNED TO THE DMP CAGE TO BE PROCESSED

item.title: Report X-2024071502
item.description:
Report X-2024071502

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-23T15:14:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-17
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: This package was brought to the QA cage for examination by a van line manager. The side of the package was wet and one side of the box was crushed. Upon inspection we noticed one of the caps on the Part B solution was loose which lead to the package being wet and contaminated. We made sure to place this box in a lined hazmat tote and moved it to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024071299
item.description:
Report X-2024071299

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-22T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-15
  • City: DURHAM
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The damaged package was placed in a hazardous materials tote and taken to the hazardous materials staging area away from personnel and other packages. Upon inspection it was noted that the lid of the metal pail of adhesives was dented causing the lid to loosen and the contents to spill. There was no packaging in the box. The damaged package was placed in a hazardous materials drum awaiting disposition.
